creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
description: burnished terracotta, in the from of a pumpkin held up by three Parrot shaped feet
text: Squash were staple crops of ancient Mexico--dried versions were some of the earliest containers for food and drink. This deep orange, symmetrical pot perches on three feet in the form of parrots. Parrots and pumpkins were both associated with fertility and abundance in ancient Colima.
title: Vessel
